{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3140338,"name":"","username":"Nimble","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/a5b964/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-02-06T03:14:32.621Z","cooked":"

Hello everyone,
We have been testing and tuning pipelines for both Apriltags & retroreflective tape. With the tape that’s on the cone nodes, it presents a bit of a challenge, as there are multiple levels. Furthermore, some tape will be covered when cones are placed. We will use this for alignment. We were curious what methods other teams were using? We were testing using smart groups with a limit of 2 and minimum of one. We could also just look for one tape/node and crop out the upper or lower level depending on the targeted node. We are yet to decide which we will use. Just curious to see what others are doing.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":3,"updated_at":"2023-02-06T03:14:32.621Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":39,"reads":182,"readers_count":181,"score":231.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":425892,"topic_slug":"tracking-cone-nodes-with-limelight","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56803,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/tracking-cone-nodes-with-limelight/425892/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3141898,"name":"Andy Gasser","username":"gdefender","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gdefender/{size}/168507_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-08T16:52:54.063Z","cooked":"

We’re still in the early stages with this too. Right now we have two pipelines for retroreflective tape, one for the top node and one for the middle. The main difference is the sort mode, we use Highest for the top node and Lowest for the middle node. This works well as long as the node you want is visible.

We played with zoom a bit. Less to crop out the other target and more because the new retroreflective tape isn’t very good.

A more complete idea is to use pose estimation with Apriltags and odometry. When we see a retroreflective target we can estimate its location, based on the robot’s pose and the target’s tx and ty. Then we can use that estimated location to decide which target we are looking at (or reject the LED billboard in the background.)

To detail that process, we would see a target and calculate two distance estimates based on ty and the known height of the nodes. Using the tx angle and distance, we can estimate the location (Translation2d) of the target relative to the robot. Next, we can use the robot’s pose estimate to estimate the target location on the field. Finally, we can compare the estimated locations with the known locations of the middle and top nodes, and make a decision about which is most correct.
